It's My 20th Birthday - Without Notifications

â¤ï¸ Krishna Chaitanya March 2, 2024

The day I spent waiting like a complete idiot. I knew people only wished birthdays when Facebook or Snapchat reminded them. So, I decided to play a little mind gameâ€”I changed my date of birth from March 2, 2004, to January 1, 2000.Just because I wanted my day to go peacefully without random people getting involved. but to see who actually remembered me without some app whispering in their ear. It wasnâ€™t just about fake birthday wishes; it was about knowing who really thought about me without a digital Popup. And most importantly, it was about Harshi. Would she remember? Or was I just another name in a long list of â€˜Happy Birthdayâ€™ notifications sheâ€™d tap through like clearing unread messages?

To make sure no one posted stories or tagged me in birthday posts, I deactivated my Instagram a week before. This wasnâ€™t just a way to disappear for a whileâ€”it was part of my plan. If someone really cared, theyâ€™d remember on their own, right? No notifications, no reminders, just pure memory. And most importantly, I wanted to see if Harshi would remember. If she really cared, if I really meant something, she wouldnâ€™t need a push from some app.

I had planned to spend the day at home, just chilling with my family. But then these guysâ€”Nitheesh and Jaswanthâ€”kept bugging me to come to Tirupati. I told them straight up, â€œIâ€™m not interested. I just want a quiet day.â€ Honestly, I was fine meeting just them, but if anyone else saw me, I knew theyâ€™d drag me into some unnecessary meetup, and I wasnâ€™t in the mood for all that.

But they insistedâ€”â€œJust come, no celebrations, no extra people, just us three.â€ So, after a lot of back and forth, I finally gave in and went. And man, these guys really pulled a fast one on me. They actually threw a surprise party! I wasnâ€™t expecting it at all. We went around to all our old college hangout spots, talked about all the dumb stuff we did back in the day, laughed about the nonsense we used to pull off. It was fun. It was nostalgic. For a moment, I forgot about everything elseâ€”just living in the present with the two people who always had my back.

I donâ€™t know why these guys care for me so much. I never really did anything special for them, never went out of my way to help, never spent as much time with them as they did with me. But still, theyâ€™ve been there, treating me like I actually matter. And honestly, I kinda hate itâ€”not in a bad way, but in that frustrating way where you just donâ€™t understand why someone cares so much when you feel like youâ€™ve done nothing to deserve it. Itâ€™s weird, you know? People like that donâ€™t come around often, and when they do, it makes you overthinkâ€”like, why me? What did I do to deserve this kind of loyalty?

Then, around 4 PM, I headed back home to Srikalahasthi. As soon as I reached, I checked my phone.

No message from her. No call. No wish.

She forgot. Or maybe she never even cared in the first place.

That was it. That was all the proof I needed. For years, I had been waiting, convincing myself she was just busy with college, making excuses for her. But now, not even a simple â€œHappy Birthday.â€ All these years, she probably just sent wishes because some stupid social media app reminded her.

And that was the moment of clarity.

All this time, you kept waiting, holding on to the hope that one day sheâ€™d reach out first. But deep down, you always knew the truth. If she truly cared, if you really meant anything to her, she wouldnâ€™t have needed a reminder. She knows how much you love her, how much she means to you, and still, she never made a moveâ€”not even for a simple birthday wish. Maybe it was never about being busy. Maybe you just never mattered enough to her. And that realization, as harsh as it was, finallyâ€¦

Remember, she never asked you to wait. She never said she loved you. This was all in your head. So why keep doing this to yourself? Just tell her how you feel, or let it go completely. Stop wasting time on someone who never once told you she wanted you to wait. She treats you like a childhood friendâ€”nothing more, nothing less. Itâ€™s not her fault that youâ€™re stuck here, replaying memories like they mean something more than they do. Either say what you need to say or move on. But donâ€™t keep doing this to yourself for her. She never asked you to.

Sheâ€™s just being nice sometimes. Donâ€™t make it complicated. You imagined it all by yourself. The lockdown realization was perfectâ€”you know her perfectly now. Sheâ€™s nice to everyoneâ€”Iâ€™m just one of them. Thatâ€™s it.
